cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 720 mi SE of Bermuda and 580 mi NE of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic and aiming toward the southeast U.S. coast (Carolinas) late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina / South Carolina border (Cape Fear vicinity)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Surf and eventual wind impacts expected from northeast Florida through the entire Carolina coastline, highest over North and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Up to tropical-stormâ€“force gusts possible late Thursday into early Friday (23% chance of 34-kt sustained winds, 7% for 50-kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; any surge focus currently north of Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain possible if Florence shifts farther south, but current guidance keeps the heaviest totals north of Savannah.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip-current conditions already affecting the Georgia coast and may intensify through mid-week.
